h3. Issue Summary
Heading formatting is not being respected when doing a Full Space Export to PDF. When pages are being exported this way their headings (e.g. heading 1 and 2) are being demoted/changed to another heading formatting (header 3 and 4 for example).

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a test page with simple text with formatting Heading 1 and 2
 # Copy the page at least twice and make the copied versions child pages of the original one
# Navigate to *Space Settings* > *Content Tools* > *Export* > *PDF* > *Normal Export*
# Open the generated file

h3. Expected Results
* Headings to maintain their original formatting

h3. Actual Results
* Headings changing formatting when exported this way: Check file below, all the *Heading 1* were formatted with... well.. Heading 1 format (same for Heading 2).

 [^TP-260620-1957.pdf] 

h3. Workaround
(/) If viable, export single pages by clicking the *...* > Export to PDF on the top right corner of the desired page OR
(/) Do a Custom Export with the desired page (this only works for a single page export) *Space Settings* > *Content Tools* > *Export* > *PDF* > *Custom Export*
fields.summary: Heading formatting is not being respected when doing a Full Space Export to PDF

When using a PDF stylesheet to configure space exports to [have a fixed width for the width of the table columns|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/customize-exports-to-pdf-190480945.html#CustomizeExportstoPDF-Tables], it does not work:

{code}
        table.fixedTableLayout {  
table-layout: fixed !important;  
width: 98% !important;  
{code}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have a page using different width for columns inside a table.
# Add either the mentioned PDF stylesheet for spaces or for the whole application:
## For space, go to *Space settings > Look and Feel > PDF Stylesheet*.
## For the global stylesheet, tap the cog icon at the top right and select *PDF Stylesheet*
# Select a space that has the configuration applied and the page created
# Go to *Space Settings* > *Content Tools* > *Export* and select *PDF*.
# Tap *Next* and select either the *Normal* or *Custom* Export.
# Tap *Export* and download the file.

h3. Expected Results
The width of the columns should be equal.

h3. Actual Results
The width of the columns keeps the same configuration used on the page.

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: PDF Stylesheet to keep equal width for columns are not respected

It should render the macro with no error.

It shows 
{{Error rendering macro 'contributors-summary' : com.atlassian.confluence.search.v2.InvalidSearchException: ElasticsearchException[SearchPhaseExecutionException[all shards failed]]}}

So a workaround would be to convert the page in fabric editor and do not select children and descendants.

h3. Issue Summary

Include page macro with 'Space key' using the special character [:] in the page title will break.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a parent page that will contain *Include Page* macro.
 # Create a child page that contain colon, for example: 'Atlassian : Testing Page'
 # Insert *Include Page* macro in the parent page.
 # Search for 'Atlassian : Testing Page'.
 # The edit window will show the page title with the 'Space key' even if the parent and child page under the same Space, as you can see at the below image:
|!Selection_141.png!|

h3. Expected Results

The content on the include page macro showtitle in the *Include Page* edit window should show the page title.
h3. Actual Results

The include page macro breaks after some time.
h3. Workaround
 # Click on the button *Edit* on the page that you are using on the include page macro on the other page.
 # Edit the name of the page by erasing the special character ":", and then click on the button *Publish*.
 # Go to the page where you are using the *include page macro*.
 # Select the broken macro, and then click on the button *Edit*. 
 # Edit the page name and take off the special character ":", and then click on the *Save* button.

h3. Issue Summary

Inline macros are meant to be sized and displayed such that the flow of the page is uninterrupted, however, the sizing of app iframes to macro content is not working.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install the test app using the descriptor URL [https://dugaldmorrow.github.io/inlinedynamiccontentmacro/descriptor.json].
 # Insert the macro "Test Inline Dynamic Content Macro" in any page in line with any other inline content.
 # Check the macro's iframe is sized according to the content and displayed in line with the other page content.

h3. Expected Results

The macro is sized according to the macro's content.
h3. Actual Results

The macro's iframe is significantly wider than it's contents, resulting in a large gap between the macro content and the next inline content.
h3. Workaround

The app must compute and resize ({{AP.resize(200, 20)}}) the content dynamically which may not always be feasible.

fields.description:
Currently, it is not possible to natively set automatic redirect on Confluence pages. This feature can be used for some customers that would like to be able to have a custom experience, based on the user. 

Some use cases:
 * Ability to automatically redirect users that don't have permission to access the page, to another one that can add more context on it.
 * The ability to have different landing pages (using the same URL), according to the user's permission.
 * Ability to redirect users from a page that is affected by a bug or something similar.

Alternative via Marketplace Add-on:
* https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1224699/easy-redirection-for-confluence-cloud?hosting=cloud&tab=support 
* https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/183/redirection-for-confluence?hosting=cloud&tab=overview
fields.summary: Ability to automatically redirect users from one page to another on Confluence Cloud

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
In the Premium edition of Confluence, besides the multiple tracking functionalities of the [Analytics app|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/analytics-972332388.html], one of them is to see who viewed and the number of views for an attachment. However, the app does not track the download data for attachments.

h4. Suggestion

This is a suggestion to include the data to include analytics for attachment downloads. This can help in terms of seeing what is the most\less popular attachment and auditing. Specifically, some data like the following:

* In the *Attachments* part of the page analytics, besides the '*Views*', '*Last viewed*' and '*Name*' options, have one called '*Downloads*' including the number of downloads.
* In the downloads part, have a part pointing to the users who downloaded it.
* When accessing the *Spaces* part, have the same *Attachments* session available, which at the moment, is only available for pages.
fields.summary: Track attachment downloads with Analytics

{quote}
 !Screen Shot 2020-06-23 at 18.20.08.png|thumbnail!

h3. Issue Summary
If a template is using the Legacy editor, and the instance has in-editor templates whenever you create a page based on this template you'll get a correct preview of the page, however clicking *Create* you'll be redirected to a blank page  using the new editor;

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Click the *Create* button o the top bar;
# Select the template using the legacy editor and has *variables*;
# Preview the page and click > *Create*.

h3. Expected Results
* Page to be created based on this template.

h3. Actual Results
* User is redirected back to a blank page using the new editor

h3. Workaround
(/) Remove *Variables* from the template and pages will be created normally; OR
(/) Recreate the template using the new editor, as close to the original template as possible; OR
(/) Close the blank page, then navigate to Recent > Drafts and open the last worked draft - your page will open in the legacy editor, according to its source template, with the content there.

h3. Issue Summary
Work with Bitbucket and Confluence is awesome when we need do document a script from our repository since it helps us to keep things on track! 
When we paste a link from a Bitbucket repo within Confluence, it renders as a smart card (a fancy icon for that link). Though, if we have the IP Whitelisting set up on Bitbucket, this functionality won't work.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Copy the link of any of your Bitbucket repos;
# Paste it within a Confluence page - note it loading as a smart card;
# Go to your Bitbucket site (make sure to be an admin);
# Follow the steps on [this KB|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/control-access-to-your-private-content-862621261.html] in ordert to enable the whitelisting restriction (make sure to add your IP address on this list);
# Go back to the Confluence page and refresh it.

h3. Expected Results
The smart card is loaded fine in the link.

h3. Actual Results
The smart card doesn't load as expected, showing the repository URL followed by "_Try another account._"

*Notes*:
* Even whitelisting all the Atlassian IP address we have on [this documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/atlassian-cloud-ip-ranges-and-domains-744721662.html], it doesn't work.

h3. Workaround
If possible, disable the IP whitelisting setting.

h3. Issue Summary

Similar to, CONFCLOUD-65206, when a page has [too many restrictions|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/add-or-remove-page-restrictions/], macros that require labels to display it, like the [Recently updated|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-recently-updated-macro/] (with the label parameter) and the [Content by label|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-content-by-label-macro/] will not have its child pages displayed in the results.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page and a few child pages for it.
 # Add a lot of restrictions into the parent page (individual user restrictions)
 # Add a label to the created hierarchy of pages.
 # Create a different page and add the [Content by label|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-content-by-label-macro/] or the [Recently updated|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-recently-updated-macro/] (using the label parameter) macro
 # Add the created label into the macro's configuration.
 # Publish the page

h3. Expected Results

The macros should display all the pages with the specified labels.
h3. Actual Results

Only the parent page with a lot of restrictions will be displayed in the macro results. The child pages that inherit such restrictions will not be displayed.
h3. Workaround

Reorganize the page restrictions by changing individual entries to groups. For the [Recently updated|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-recently-updated-macro/] macro, you can also use a different parameter to retrieve the pages.
fields.summary: Pages with too many restrictions will not have its children displayed in specific macros

h3. Issue Summary

If the page has a code block macro with a ['START OF HEADING' (U+0001)|https://www.fileformat.info/info/unicode/char/0001/browsertest.htm] character (happens with other special characters as well) inside of it, it won't be possible to publish this page, with a 500 http error.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page and add a Code snippet macro
 # Type something inside the code snippet
 # Publish the page and edit it again
 # Access [https://www.fileformat.info/info/unicode/char/0001/browsertest.htm] and copy the character inside of the test input
 # Paste it two times inside of the code block macro 
 # Try to publish the page

h3. Expected Results

The page should be published
h3. Actual Results

The following errors are shown on the page:
{code:none}
Unable to communicate with server. Saving is not possible at the moment.{code}
{code:none}
Something's gone wrong.

Try again later.{code}
The request fails with a HTTP 500:
{code:none}
Request URL: https://INSTANCE.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/api/content/1234567/?status=draft&action=publish
Request Method: PUT
Status Code: 500 

Response
{"statusCode":500,"message":"com.ctc.wstx.exc.WstxLazyException: [com.ctc.wstx.exc.WstxLazyException] Illegal character ((CTRL-CHAR, code 1))\n at [row,col {unknown-source}]: [1843,-26]"}{code}
(on) The character can be found by searching for "\u0001" in the draft's ADF code.
h3. Workaround

Remove the character from the code block macro. 
 If you can't find the character, submit a request with us at [https://support.atlassian.com/] including a link to this bug report.
fields.summary: Can't publish page if there're certain characters inside of a code snippet macro

{panel:title=Status Update 28 July 2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ff7f7f|titleBGColor=#ff7f7f|bgColor=#e5e5e5}
Hi all,

This is Ethan from the Atlassian Editor Team. Thank you for the continuous feedback on performance improvement needs within the Confluence editing experience. Over the past 12 months, Atlassian teams have been improving our monitoring capabilities to detect performance degradation and updating various parts of the backend architecture to improve 2 issues of primary concern outlined in our last update: *keyboard typing performance* and *frozen pages*. As a result, editing input latency spike has dropped from 274ms at p99 to 80ms from November 2020 to July 2021. Similarly, fewer customers are citing frozen pages while trying to edit pages.

Nonetheless, we recognise there is still plenty of ground to cover on making our products faster. *New themes* are emerging in the more recent customer reports, so we will deprecating this ticket by splitting it into the following to better track different performance degradations:
||Theme||Ticket||
|1. Slowness rendering Non-Content PAGE FEATURES when VIEWING a Confluence page |[CONFCLOUD-72517|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-72517]|
|2. Slowness rendering IN-PAGE CONTENT when VIEWING a large Confluence page|[CONFCLOUD-72518|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-72518]|
|3. Slowness initially rendering a large Confluence page in EDIT mode|[CONFCLOUD-72519|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-72519]|
|4. Keyboard typing delays while trying to EDIT a Confluence page|[CONFCLOUD-72520|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-72520]|
|5. Changes are lost and unsaved after EDITING a Confluence page|[CONFCLOUD-72521|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-72521]|

Atlassian teams will focus upcoming efforts to *actively address themes 1-3*, which involves optimising the performance of the base editor and renderer components. This should improve the time-to-interact for both the page editing and viewing experiences in Confluence for all types of pages. Following this, we will narrow our focus on optimising the performance of specific page elements when editing pages with large amounts of content, including tables, macros, and other media.

In the mean time, we will *continue to monitor issues* related to *themes 4-6*. To improve both the viewing and editing speeds of large pages, we still recommend *splitting up the page into multiple pages* for a more performant experience.

Thanks all and stay safe,

h3. Issue Summary
When adding an inline comment to a page, as a non-space administrator, the comment can be edited, but, after refreshing the page, the option to allow the user to edit its own comment is gone.

From [Comment on pages and blog posts|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/comment-on-pages-and-blog-posts/], as long as the user has the *Add* comment permission in the space, the comment should be able to be edited.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Confluence page with some text and publish it.
# As a non-space administrator, add an inline comment to the inserted text.
# As the first comment can never be edited, add a new comment to the inline comment thread.
# Refresh the page.

h3. Expected Results
The *edit* option should be displayed to allow the users to edit their own comments.

h3. Actual Results
The *edit* option is gone.

*Additional notes*

* The first comment of the thread can never be edited, even if the user is a space administrator.
* Before refreshing the page, the *edit* option will be displayed. If the user taps on it, the editing will properly work.
* Even if the inline comment pop-up is closed and then re-opened before refreshing the page, the *edit* option will still be displayed.
* Space administrators do not face this behavior. 

The table below demonstrates the performed tests in a test site:

||Scenario||Can the comment be edited?||Notes||Screenshot of the behavior|
|Adding the first inline comment|(x)|The first comment of the thread can never be edited, even as an admin|!first.png|thumbnail!|
|Adding a new comment to the thread as a space-admin|(/)|Additional comments can always be edited as a space-admin| !admin-edit.png|thumbnail!|
|Adding a new comment to the thread as a non-admin|(/)|My own comment can be edited| !before-refresh.png|thumbnail! |
|Adding a new comment to the thread as a non-admin and refresh the page|(x)|After refreshing the page, I can no longer edit my own comment in the thread|!after_refresh.png|thumbnail!|


h3. Workaround

As the issue happens after refreshing the page, have the user editing the comment prior to doing so. If needed, have a space administrator editing the comment(s).
fields.summary: Refreshing a page does not allow Inline comments to be edited as a non-space administrator
